title: Lisa Snowdon on why she's more confident than ever as she approaches 50
text:

Lisa Snowdon admits she's more confident than ever as she approaches the big 5-0.

The presenter is due to mark the milestone in a few years, but says she's not worried about it in the slightest.

The This Morning star, 47, is happier than ever with fiancé George Smart and admits she no longer sweats the small stuff.

"Age is just a number," she told Mirror Online during an exclusive chat.

"I know that's a cliché but I don't think it should bother you that much, it's just a waste of energy."

Lisa chatted to us as she teamed up with Seven Seas Perfect7 Plus to support their Confidence Curve campaign.

(Image: THEOCOHEN)

(Image: THEOCOHEN)

She takes the supplements every day and says they help keep her on top form.

She said: "It just seems like a natural collaboration for me because I've always been into health and looking after myself.

"The age I'm at now, I do look after myself with exercise and what I eat but it's good to take a vitamin as well to make sure you get everything you need, and it's good for your hair and nails too, and it has all those good ingredients to help you stay strong as well.

"It's also really good for my immune system as well so I love the whole ethos of it and the fact it's got this perfect seven.

"It's a really great supplement and I'm all about promoting wellness and confidence and feeling good from the inside out."

(Image: Rex)

Lisa said both men and women grow in confidence as they reach certain milestones in life, such as passing their driving test, having a baby or buying their own home.

But she said a lot of people grow in confidence as they learn to care less about what other people think.

She said: "I think there's an element of self acceptance and you get to the age where you stop worrying so much.

"Obviously we all want to look our best and be the best versions of ourselves but obviously you don't want to stress about it so much as long as you're feeling good and you've got energy and you're healthy, that's such a major factor in feeling good every day and you worry less about the small things."

As Lisa nears her 50th birthday, she said she's not going to get worked up about it.

(Image: Instagram)

She told us: "I've never really been worried about turning a certain age. I think if you're progressing and happy where you are, if you're striving in your job and have a nice place to live and you've reached some milestones that make you feel like you're achieving more and you're more grown up that's what matters.

"It can be a little daunting when you get into your 30s and then leave them and go into your 40s and then into your 50s, but if you're feeling good then you're winning really."

Lisa also said a good support network of friends and family is key to confidence.

And it sounds like she's won the lottery when it comes to George, who popped the question in 2017 after 14 months of dating.

She said: "I think we're really good for each other in that way, we've got a really loving, stable relationship which I think is amazing, I can't stress how lovely it is to be in that.

(Image: Instagram)

"There's no drama, we're a team so I think we're really good for each other in that way and we're able to talk about everything and he's a good listener.

"It's definitely a big bonus having someone like that in your life.

"He ticks all the boxes so I'm really lucky."
